basics.name: Pablo Gonzalez Murillo
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a technology and software passionate. I have experience working as a backend and frontend developer, contributing with Costa Rica and North American companies. I define myself as an enterprising person and social activist, I have experience leading people and making business decisions. I really love be updated about the changes in the software community to challenge myself to improve as a professional.

client.name: I.C.E (The biggest Costa Rican telecommunications company)

highlights: Migrate old modules to ICEfaces.
Create new modules and release the project for the first stable version.
Manage the technical decision of the project.
During this time I gained proficiency in Front-End technologies such as CSS, HTML, and several javascript based frameworks.

projects.name: Viajes

client.name: I.C.E (The biggest Costa Rican telecommunications company)

highlights: Get stable and release a critical project.
I worked on a huge project migration to J2EE, I had responsibilities such as requirement gathering, management, and coding .
I served on several projects center on Front-End technologies. I was in charge of estimations, Linux server administration tasks and coding.
During this time I gained proficiency in Front-End technologies such as CSS, HTML, and several javascript based frameworks.
During my staying in Prodigious, I served as Front-End developer for Onstar account.
I contributed mostly on tasks related to javascript,  API's integration and improving the code quality.
I assumed experience working with AEM 5.6, Angularjs and HTML5.
I had the opportunity to take the leadership role and help my team members.
SWorked as a full-stack developer for significant government's project.
Worked under pressure for a critical project.
Requirement analysis and client management were my functions as well.
